isis.stitle: 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS INTERNATIONAL MODEL ES52-7A AND ESO65-7A 6-PLUS - REASSEMBLY - REAR CASE

step1.para: Install the thrust rings on the intermediate bearings. Continue by installing the bearings, Figure 82.
Lock the transmission into two gears. Using the special socket (SE4323). Install the nut on the mainshaft and torque it to value listed in Torque Chart, Figure 83.

Install the intermediate bearing retainer plates. The mainshaft bearing plate has a groove that lines up with the lubrication trough tab in the housing. Do not use gaskets or sealing com pounds on either cap. Torque the capscrews to proper torque listed in Torque Chart. Be sure to install mainshaft bearing oil trough as shown, Figure 84.

figure.caption: Figure 84. Install Intermediate Bearing Retainer Plates

step1.para: Next install the bearing and low gear onto the rear mainshaft. Also install the lock ball, thrust washer and snap ring, Figure 85.

figure.caption: Figure 85. Bearing and Low Gear Onto Rear Mainshaft

step1.para: Use EP2 Moly Grease and coat the mainshaft splines. Then install the rear mainshaft, Figure 86.
If the trough was removed earlier, check now to make sure there is clearance between it and low gear (arrow), Figure 87.

figure.caption: Figure 87. Clearance Between Trough and Low Gear

step1.para: Install the low/reverse shift bar and collar. When the shift bar won't drop further, push in on the fork bars at the shift tower opening while pushing the fork bar bracket down. This will aid alignment. Secure shift bar bracket with capscrews. Tighten capscrews to torque value listed on Torque Chart, Figure 88.
Next install the caged bearing and reverse gear. The gear hub should face the bearing. Install the thrust washer, with the tapered side up, Figure 89.

figure.caption: Figure 89. Caged Bearing and Reverse Gear

step1.para: Place the rear case on a bench and prepare to in stall the reverse idler gear assembly. Two tabbed thrust washers are part of the assembly. The tabs fit into grooves inside the case (arrow). Make sure these tabs don't become bent during disas sembly or reassembly, Figure 90.

Assemble the bearings, reverse idler gear, and thrust washers onto the idler shaft and install the assembly. Make sure the bearings are packed with EP2 Moly Grease. Also make sure the brass sides of the washers face the gear. Illustration shows washer tabs engaged with grooves in case, Figure 91.

figure.caption: Figure 91. Washer Tabs Engaged With Grooves in Case

step1.para: The straight edge on the end of the idler shaft must be positioned as shown here. Tap it into the case so the top portion of the shaft is flush with the case, or not more than .030" below the case surface. The lower portion of the idler shaft will extend about 1/4" above the case as shown in the next illustration, Figure 92.

figure.caption: Figure 92. Straight Edge On Idler Shaft

step1.para: Coat the case sealing surface with Loctite Gasket Eliminator (purple). Then install the rear case with the aid of a chain hoist. Secure with caps crews. Torque capscrews to specified values listed in Torque Chart. If a new low/reverse shift bar support was installed in the rear case, make sure the low/reverse bar is shifting properly, Figure 93.
Next install the rear mainshaft bearing, using the proper driver to avoid bearing damage. Also in stall the countershaft and the countershaft bearing, Figure 94.

Coat the countershaft bearing retainer with Loctite Gasket Eliminator (purple). Do not put sealant in oil groove. Secure bearing retainer with capscrews and tighten to specified torque value listed in Torque Chart, Figure 95.

figure.caption: Figure 95. Secure Bearing Retainer With Capscrews

step1.para: Install the signal gear (arrow) and the mainshaft bearing retainer and gasket. Make sure the bear ing cap oil passage lines up with the oil passage in the transmission housing. Tighten capscrews to torque values listed in Torque Chart, Figure 96.

Check end play. Remove the PTO cover and position a dial indicator. Use a pry bar to lift up on a gear. End play should measure between .001" - .008". If end play is correct, replace the PTO cap and torque the capscrews to torque value listed on Torque Chart. If end play is not correct, add or subtract shims under the rear countershaft bearing retainer, Figure 97.
Install mainshaft flange or yoke and nut. Torque nut to specified torque value listed in Torque Chart.
Set transmission in normal operation position.
Reinstall plunger pusher spring and plunger plug. (See step number 5.)
Install the backup light switch if it was removed earlier. Torque to value listed in Torque Chart, Figure 98.
Next install the plungers and springs, Figure 99.
Bench shift the unit to make sure all forks are shifting properly, Figure 100.

Install a gasket, the interlock plate, and the final gasket. Note the position of the interlock plate. This photograph shows its correct position. Next, shift all gears into neutral. The transmission is now ready for installation. Transmission shift tower can then be installed after the trans mission is installed. Torque capscrews to torque value listed in Torque Chart, Figure 101.

figure.caption: Figure 101. Correct Position of Interlock Plate
